desc_content.paragraph: This function creates a suitable page title in the form: Specific | Less Specific | General | edX It will output the correct platform name for the request. Pass in a separator kwarg to override the default of “ | “

section.title: openedx.core.djangoapps.site_configuration.middleware module
section.paragraph: This file contains Django middleware related to the site_configuration app.

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: MiddlewareMixin

Special case middleware which should be at the very end of the MIDDLEWARE list (so that it runs first on the process_response chain). This middleware will define a wrapper function for the set_cookie() function on the HttpResponse object, if the request is running in a middleware.
This wrapped set_cookie will change the SESSION_COOKIE_DOMAIN setting so that the cookie can be bound to a fully customized URL.
Django middleware hook for process responses
Bases: Model
Model for storing site configuration. These configuration override OpenEdx configurations and settings. e.g. You can override site name, logo image, favicon etc. using site configuration.

This is an archive table for SiteConfiguration, so that we can maintain a history of changes. Note that the site field is not unique in this model, compared to SiteConfiguration.

section.title: Module contents
section.paragraph: This app is used for creating/updating site’s configuration. This app encapsulate configuration related logic for sites and provides a way for sites to override default/system behavioural or presentation logic.

definition.paragraph: This model contains configuration for a site and can be used to override OpenEdx configurations.
site (OneToOneField): one to one field relating each configuration to a single site values (JSONField): json field to store configurations for a site
configuration of each site would be available as configuration attribute to django site. If you want to access current site’s configuration simply access it as request.site.configuration.
This model keeps a track of all the changes made to SiteConfiguration with time stamps.
site (ForeignKey): foreign-key to django Site values (JSONField): json field to store configurations for a site

configuration history of each site would be available as configuration_histories attribute to django site. If you want to access a list of current site’s configuration history simply access it as request.site.configuration_histories.all().
